title: MLB.TV EPG
custom_preconds: Given a user has the app installed

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the MLB.TV EPG button on a handset
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the list of all scheduled games for a given day with their game time

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps on the MLB.TV EPG button on a tablet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the EPG will pop up in the middle of the screen

custom_steps_separated.content: When there is a Free Game of the Day scheduled
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user will see the game labeled, "MLB.TV Game of the Day"

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user taps on a game on the EPG with multiple feeds available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the menu will expand to show the available TV feeds
and each feed will be a blue button with the team name's code and the TV feed's call letters

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user taps on a game with multiple feeds available
that has already been expanded
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the menu will collapse
and the available TV feeds will be hidden

title: General
custom_preconds:
**Cases should be run on Handset and Tablet unless otherwise noted**

Cases specific to Handset are marked by **[H]**
Cases specific to Tablet are marked by **[T]**

User should be logged in with entitled MLB.TV account unless case requires user to be a LITE user or non-entitled user

custom_steps_separated.content: **[H]** User expands Scoreboard game cell and taps on the MLB.TV button for game that has an MLB.TV stream available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a blackout and BAMSDK check should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

custom_steps_separated.content: **[H]** User taps on MLB.TV button in the score module of the team page for a game that has an MLB.TV stream available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a blackout and BAMSDK check should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

custom_steps_separated.content: **[H]** User taps on MLB.TV stream in EPG for game that has an MLB.TV stream available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a blackout and BAMSDK check should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

custom_steps_separated.content: **[T]** User taps on MLB.TV stream in EPG for game that has an MLB.TV stream available
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then a blackout and BAMSDK check should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is not entitled for MLB.TV attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
And taps the "$24.99 Monthly" button on the pay wall
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Play Store In-App Purchase flow should appear to purchase TV Premium

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user is not entitled for MLB.TV attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
And taps the 'Sign in with MLB.com account' button on the pay wall
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.com login screen should load

And there should be:

boxes for 'Email' and 'Password'
a 'Login' button
links for 'Privacy Policy' and 'Forgot Password?'
and a 'View FAQ' button

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has launched the MLB.com login screen
And the user taps the 'Up' button in the app or the device back button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV login screen should close
And the user should be taken back to the screen they were on when they attempted to launch the MLB.TV stream

custom_steps_separated.content: User taps 'View FAQ' button on MLB.com login screen
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be taken to an internal webview with the app FAQ for the Android MLB app platform

title: Ads Play in Feed
custom_preconds: GIVEN an entitled user is logged in
custom_steps: WHEN a game with media is streamed
custom_expected:
THEN ads play during commercial breaks
AND more than one ad break runs successfully

title: SVOD
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user with SVOD entitlements is signed in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user accesses EPG (mobile app) or Videos Screen(TV app)
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN "FEATURED" Tab appears in EPG (mobile app) or Videos Screen (TV app) that is populated with SVOD Content thunmbnails

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN user selects an SVOD content thumbnail
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the SVOD content should successfully stream

title: Lite User
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is Lite user

custom_steps_separated.content:
LITE user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
And the user logs in with a TV account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout and BAMSDK checks should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

custom_steps_separated.content:
LITE user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
And the user logs in with an At Bat Premium account
And it is NOT the offseason
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should NOT be able to access the MLB.TV stream 
And the user should be brought back to the MLB.TV Paywall where they should see an error message informing them that they are not entitled to access the stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
LITE user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
And the user logs in with an At Bat Premium account
And it IS the offseason
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should NOT be able to access the MLB.TV stream 
And the user should be brought back to the MLB.TV Paywall where they should see an error message informing them that they are not entitled to access the stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
LITE user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
And the user logs in with a non-entitled MLB.com account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should NOT be able to access the MLB.TV stream
And the user should be brought back to the MLB.TV Paywall where they should see an error message informing them that they are not entitled to access the stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
LITE user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
And the user logs in with an Executive account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout check and BAMSDK check should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

Verify: User can watch stream they would normally be blacked out from viewing. (eg. Live Yankees or Mets game from within NY area)

title: MLB Audio User
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content: User with MLB Audio access (but no MLB.TV entitlement) attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see the MLB.TV Pay Wall
And the user should not be able to access the stream

custom_steps_separated.content: At Bat In-App Purchase user attempts to launch MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should NOT be able to access the MLB.TV stream
And the user should be brought to the MLB.TV Paywall where they should see an error message informing them that they are not entitled to access the stream

title: TV User
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and the user is logged in with a TV account
custom_steps: When the user launches any MLB.TV stream
custom_expected:
Then the blackout and mediaframework checks should occur
And the stream should begin to play on the device

title: Free Trial User
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed
custom_steps: Verify Free Trial user has access to free MLB.TV Game of the Day
custom_expected: User should be able to launch the Free game of the day and change feeds within stream without issue

title: General
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
Verify credentials are saved when the user has logged in with an entitled account and the user:

Exits the app
Force stops the app from settings
Restarts the device

And subsequently attempts to access an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should begin to play
And the user should NOT be prompted to re-enter their credentials

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has logged in with an entitled account
And the user changes or resets their account password on the Web or through another device
And the user attempts to start an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should not be allowed to start the MLB.TV stream
And the user should be prompted to log in with an entitled accoun

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to launch 9 concurrent MLB.TV streams across different devices logged in with the same credentials
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should receive a login error on the final and subsequent devices informing them that they have reached the maximum number of concurrent sessions

title: Anonymous User (not logged-in)
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is an MLB.TV Game of the Day scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user who is NOT logged in with an MLB.com account attempts to launch an MLB.TV Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user is taken to a Login screen
with messaging indicating that the user may access the Game of the Day with a free MLB.com account

"The MLB Free Game of the Day is available to all users with a valid MLB.com account. Login to your account for access to this broadcast, or register for a free MLB.com account by tapping "Register" below."

custom_steps_separated.content: If the user's login attempt fails
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then there will be a message to inform the user of failed login

custom_steps_separated.content: If the user is on the login screen, but cancels without logging in
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be returned to the previously viewed screen

custom_steps_separated.content: If the user logs in successfully with an MLB.com account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the MLB.TV Game of the Day feed
(pending blackouts)

custom_steps_separated.content: If the user completes a successful account registration
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be taken to the MLB.TV Game of the Day feed
(pending blackouts)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the non-entitled logged-in user attempts to launch any other feed (not Game of the Day)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be prompted by the TV paywall
with messaging that they do not have TV access with that account

title: Logged in with non-entitled account
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is an MLB.TV Game of the Day scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user logged in with a non-entitled MLB.com account attempts to launch a Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout & BAMSDK checks will occur
and the user will be taken to the feed

title: Paid & Single Team Users
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there is an MLB.TV Game of the Day scheduled

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user logged in with an At Bat account attempts to launch a Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout & BAMSDK checks will occur
and the user will be taken to the feed

custom_steps_separated.content: When a user logged in with a TV account attempts to launch a Game of the Day feed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout & BAMSDK checks will occur
and the user will be taken to the feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When a user logged in with a Single Team account attempts to launch a Game of the Day feed
regardless of the teams playing
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout & BAMSDK checks will occur
and the user will be taken to the feed

title: Device Rotation
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with a TV Premium account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user starts up an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video should begin to play in whichever orientation the device was in when the user launched the stream
(if in portrait, then portrait; if in landscape, then landscape)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing an MLB.TV feed
And the user rotates the device 90 degrees or 180 degrees
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video orientation should rotate along with the device orientation
And the video should NOT restart/relaunch

title: Feed Selector
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with TV Premium account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the feed selector drop down in the top left corner
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the Away team's feed should be on the top of the cell and the Home team's feed should be underneath

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the feed selector drop down
And selects the video feed that is not currently being played (opposing team's feed)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video should switch to the other feed
And the team icon associated with the new feed should appear in the top left corner of the player

title: Player Controls
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with a TV Premium account
and has launched an MLB.TV stream

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Back' button on the device while playing MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV player should close 
And the user should be taken to the page from which they launched the MLB.TV stream

title: Closed Captions
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with a TV Premium account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user starts an MLB.TV stream for the first time
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the Closed Captions button in the player should be defaulted to "Off"
And the closed captions should not appear while the video stream is playing

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the "CC" button in the player
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the CC button should appear selected
And the closed captions should appear during the video

(Toggle back and forth to verify this works over and over)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user has turned on Closed Captions
And the user stops one stream and restarts another stream
And when the user closes the app (force stops the app in settings) and relaunches the app and restarts another stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the closed caption setting the user had selected should be maintained between sessions.

(ie. If the user had CC set to ON then CC should be on when the user starts another stream. If the user had CC set to OFF then they should remain off when the user starts another stream.)

title: Streaming Tests
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with a TV Premium account

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to stream MLB.TV across a Wifi connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to play the stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to stream MLB.TV across carrier connection
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be able to play the stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user stops playing a stream for one game
And the user begins playing a stream for another game
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be able to start the new stream
(Try this over and over until confident that no performance issues may become apparent)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user sends the app to the background while playing MLB.TV
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the stream becomes PiP (go into smaller screen and keeps playing)

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
and plugs earphones into the device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream continue playing
and there should be no issue with playback or with audio

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
And the user receives a phone call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should be stopped to hear the phone call ring and prompt the user to answer or decline
And when the phone call is answered the user should only hear the audio from the phone call and not audio from the MLB.TV stream
And when the phone call is ended the user should be able to restart the MLB.TV stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
And the user ignores a phone call
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should be stopped to hear the phone call ring and prompt the user to answer or ignore
And when the phone call is ignored the user should be able to restart the MLB.TV stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can receive phone call while streaming MLB.TV over carrier connection
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should be stopped to hear the phone call ring and prompt the user to answer or decline
And when the phone call is answered the user should only hear the audio from the phone call and not audio from the MLB.TV stream
And when the phone call is ended the user should be able to restart the MLB.TV stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
And the user receives a text message
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should continue playing
And the user should hear the notification tone alerting them that a new message has been received
And the stream should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify user can receive text message while streaming MLB.TV over carrier connection
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should continue playing
And the user should hear the notification tone alerting them that a new message has been received
And the stream should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
And the user receives an email or any other notification
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should continue playing
And the user should hear the notification tone alerting them that a new alert has been received
And the stream should continue to play

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing MLB.TV
And an alarm is set and goes off on the device
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the MLB.TV stream should stop playing
And the user should be prompted to dismiss or snooze the alarm
And whichever the user chooses, they should be allowed to resume the stream when they return to the app

title: Display Settings
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and user is logged in with a TV Premium account
custom_steps:
When the user has their device's display settings set to go to sleep after x minutes of inactivity
and starts playing an MLB.TV stream
and leaves the phone alone
custom_expected:
Then the device's display should never time out
and the MLB.TV stream should continue to play, regardless of the display settings

title: Label
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there are archived feeds available

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user navigates to the MLB.TV EPG view
on a handset
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive games should appear with an 'Archive' label on the right

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user opens the MLB.TV EPG drop down
on a tablet
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the archive games should appear with an 'Archive' label on the right

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user navigates to a past date on the MLB.TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should see the archive games with an 'Archive' label on the right

title: Entitlements
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content: When an entitled user taps an Archived game stream on the MLB.TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the stream should launch
And the stream should play without issue

custom_steps_separated.content: When a non-entitled user taps on an Archived game stream on the MLB.TV EPG
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the user should be presented with the MLB.TV Pay Wall

title: Game of the Day
custom_preconds:
Given At Bat is installed
and there are Game of the Day feeds archived

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify the archived MLB.TV Game of the Day is noted as such
custom_steps_separated.expected: The user should see clearly labeled lettering indicating which stream is the MLB.TV Game of the Day archive

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify archived MLB.TV Game of the Day requires only user to be logged in with MLB.com account
custom_steps_separated.expected: User logged in with ANY sort of MLB.com account (lite or paid) should be able to stream MLB.TV Game of the Day archived stream

title: Blackouts
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed
custom_steps: When a user in a blacked out area attempts to launch an archive stream (eg. User in New York attempting to launch Archive stream for Yankees Local Blackout game)
custom_expected:
Then the user should NOT be blacked out from the archive
And the stream should play without issue

title: Player Controls
custom_preconds:
Given MLB app is installed
and user is logged in with TV Premium account

custom_steps_separated.content: When user starts archive stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video playback should launch at the point that the game broadcast started
(The user should not sit on the "Game will begin shortly' slate for an unreasonable amount of time)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user plays the archive stream
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then the video player should contain a seek bar so the user can navigate through the stream

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is playing an archive stream
And they attempt to seek forward or backward with the seek bar
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the video playback should adjust to the selected point appropriately
And the user should be able to navigate forward and backward in a stream without issue

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user taps the opposite feed button for Home vs. Away feeds in an archive stream
(On TV, the alternate stream is listed on the scoreboard page)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the feed for the opposite team should begin without issue
And the feed should jump to the beginning of the game broadcast

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user is playing an archive game feed there should not be a 'Stop' button in the player when the user brings up the player controls
custom_steps_separated.expected: Then they should see a Pause button that pauses and turns into a play button that then plays the stream when tapped

title: Blackouts
custom_preconds:
Local Blackout - User cannot stream game if they are geolocated within either the Away or Home Team's viewing areas
National Blackout - User cannot stream game if they are geolocated within the US or Canada

(Note: Executive accounts are not subject to blackout restrictions)

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to access a game that is set up with a Local Blackout from a blacked out location with a TV Premium account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout check and BAMSDK check should occur
And the user should be taken to the blackout information page where they should see a map of their location along with Local Blackout information

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to access a game that is set up with a National Blackout from a blacked out location with a TV Premium account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout check and BAMSDK check should occur
And the user should be taken to the blackout information page where they should see a map of their location along with National Blackout information

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user taps the 'Help' button on the Blackout information page
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should be taken to an internal webview with the app FAQ
And the FAQ should contain information about blackout restrictions

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to access an MLB.TV Game of the Day with any entitled account and they are within a local blackout area
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout check and BAMSDK check should occur
And the user should be taken to the blackout information page where they should see a map of their location along with Local Blackout information

custom_steps_separated.content: When a Lite user attempts to access a game that is set up with a Local Blackout from a blacked out location
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user will be gated by the TV paywall 
which will include a "Check local blackouts" webview link

custom_steps_separated.content: When the user attempts to access a game that is set up with a Local or National blackout with an Executive account
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the blackout check and BAMSDK check should occur
And the video should begin to play without issue
(The user should NOT be blacked out)

title: Location Permissions
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns off location services on an Android Handset or Tablet (non-Kindle device)
(Settings -> Location Services)
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should receive a message to enable a location service
And tapping "OK" should bring them to the Location Services page in Settings

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user is a Lite user or is not logged in with an MLB.TV account
And the user turns off location services on an Android Handset or Tablet (non-Kindle device)
(Settings -> Location Services)
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should see a message on the paywall stating that "Location Services are disabled. To reliably check your blackout area, please enable a location service"
And after logging in with an MLB.tv entitled account the user should get another message to "Please enable a location service"

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns off location services on an Amazon Kindle Fire tablet
(Settings -> Wireless > Location Services)
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should receive a message that At Bat is having trouble verifying location
and to make sure location services are enabled

title: Mock Locations
custom_preconds: Given At Bat is installed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns on Mock Locations in device Settings
(Settings=>Applications=>Development, or Settings=>Developer Options)
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should receive a message stating "At Bat is unable to reliably verify your location. Tap Help below for more information"
And the Help button should take the user to the FAQ page

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns Mock Locations off in settings
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the app should check the user's location
And launch the proper MLB.tv feed

custom_steps_separated.content:
When the user turns on Mock locations without killing the app
(Make sure app resumes and does not launch fresh)
And the user attempts to launch an MLB.TV stream
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Then the user should receive a message stating "At Bat is unable to reliably verify your location. Tap Help below for more information"
And the Help button should take the user to the FAQ page
